metadata.name: Firewall Configuration Discovery Via Netsh.EXE
metadata.comment: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\netsh.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('netsh.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('netsh ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('show ')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('firewall ')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('config ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('state ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('rule ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('name=all'))))

output.summary: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

metadata.objective: False positive: Administrative activity References: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1016/T1016.md#atomic-test-2---list-windows-firewall-rules, https://ss64.com/nt/netsh.html
